result.execSummary:
The defendant Martinez M Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

No DNA sample or DNA surcharge ordered on this case as it has been ordered on case 15CF120.
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Collected by DOC out of up to 25% of prison funds and wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
--Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 5.5 years Initial Confinement in cases 15CF120 and 15CF2010.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the coactor Jonathan Jones.

Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those a listed.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

5/3/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.
Count two.
Count one.

Defendant Martinez M Edwards in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Martinez M Edwards in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty for Karen Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.   

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court ordered the defendant to serve 2 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1.5 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1.5 years.

AS TO EACH COUNT:
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the co-actor:  Jonathan Jones.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

- No DNA sample or DNA surcharge ordered on this case as it has been ordered on case 15CF120.  
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 5.5 years initial confinement in cases 15CF120 and 15CF2010.

Appeal rights given. 
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Martinez M Edwards not in court, in custody.  No appearance by the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing.  Defense counsel is in trial in another court and requests new date.    Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Martinez M Edwards in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Martinez M Edwards in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing.   Due to time, sentencing was adjourned.  

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Martinez M Edwards not in court, in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea and sentencing date.    Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.    Filed, signed Felony Scheduling Order.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Conen.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26, Room 634 Courthouse.  Parties select scheduling date before Branch 26.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:William Savagian-MPD Officer.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #15CF120 that are attached to the complaint.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Branch 07, Judge McAdams due to defendant's lower pending felony case.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07. Defendant Martinez M Edwards in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Martinez M Edwards in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State files an AMENDED CRIMINAL COMPLAINT.  Court ordered COUNT 1 CHARGE AMENDED TO: POSSESSION OF COCAINE , contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(c), a MISDEMEANOR.   Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/8/15.
